title: Roasted Rainbow Veg with Feta And Harissa Couscous
keywords: Roasted vegetables, Couscous, Harissa, Feta, Vegetarian, Middle Eastern

method.step: Preheat the oven to 220C / 200C (Fan) / Gas 7
Boil half a kettle
Take out the beetroot from the packaging and reserve the juice in a small mixing bowl for later
Cut each beetroot into wedges
Top, tail, peel and chop your carrot(s) into quarters lengthways then into batons
Add the beetroot wedges and carrot batons to a large baking tray (or two)
Sprinkle with your smoked paprika add a generous drizzle of olive oil and season with a punch of salt and pepper
Put the tray(s) in the oven for an initial 15 minutes or until the carrot batons are almost tender
Meanwhile, dissolve your vegetable stock mix in your boiled water in a large bowl, when stir in your harissa paste.  This is your harissa stock
Add your couscous to the harissa stock, cover and set aside
Heat a Small pan over a medium heigh heat
Once hot, add your pumpkin seeds and toast for 3 minutes
(Pay close attention to them so they donâ€™t burn)
Once done, set the toasted pumpkin seeds aside until serving
Chop your coriander finely including the stalks (save some leaves for garnish)
Once the carrot and beetroot have had their initial 15 minutes, crumble over your feta and drizzle over your honey
Return the tray(s) to the oven for another 5 minutes.  This is your roasted rainbow veg with feta
Meanwhile, combine the reserved beetroot juice. balsamic vinegar the chopped coriander and your olive oil with a pinch of salt and pepper in a small bowl.  This is your dressing
Fluff the cooked couscous with a fork. This is your harissa couscous
Serve the roasted rainbow veg with fetta over the harissa couscous
Drizzle with the dressing and garnish with the reserved coriander leaves and toasted pumpkin seeds
Enjoy
